Articles.Content:
Hey, thought I\'d make this thread so people can see each others specs.

From piriforms website: http://www.piriform.com/speccy

What\'s in your computer? If you\'re like most of us, you can probably name the processor (Intel or AMD, Celeron or Pentium), maybe how much RAM it has, and maybe how big the hard drive is.

When you go to a computer store and see all the bright shiny PCs laid out next to each other, most will have tags or stickers indicating the:

Processor brand and model

Hard drive size and speed

Amount of memory (RAM)

Graphics card

Operating system

Two or three years later, when it comes time to upgrade your computer, that tag or sticker may be long gone. Speccy was designed as a free electronic 'what\'s inside' sticker for your PC.

So take a screenshot of the results once its finished analyzing.

Here\'s my PC

As you can see, I have two monitors and a very powerful computer. (My CPU is overclocked to 4.5Ghz.

That\'s just one hell of a PC ???

Was it custom-built? Pretty sure KSP won\'t lag in there

That\'s just one hell of a PC ???

Was it custom-built? Pretty sure KSP won\'t lag in there

Yup, bought all the parts and assembled em. KSP never lags.

Also, mind posting your speccy? I was always curious.

Yup, bought all the parts and assembled em. KSP never lags.

Also, mind posting your speccy? I was always curious.

That\'s just cool

Also, might as well do it in my laptop, after fixing it. My HDD f-ed up all of a sudden
